intro: Artemisia mexicana var. silvicola, commonly known as silverleaf sagebrush, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine,茸毛-like hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flower heads that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils and have been used traditionally for medicinal and aromatic purposes.
